notes.text: nodejs:14 security, bug fix, and enhancement update
notes.title: Description of the Errata

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: OpenAnolis Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all OpenAnolis offerings.
publisher.name: Anolis OS Product Security Team

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in the glob-parent package. Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks, affecting system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: To fix this cve, please use the installation method recommended by Anolis: find the corresponding system's errata on the cve page, and then use errata to fix it. For details, please refer to references. For example, to fix a cve on Anolis OS 23: yum update --advisory ANSA-2024: xxxx

notes.text: A flaw was found in http-cache-semantics. When the server reads the cache policy from the request using this library, a Regular Expression Denial of Service occurs, caused by malicious request header values sent to the server.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: To fix this cve, please use the installation method recommended by Anolis: find the corresponding system's errata on the cve page, and then use errata to fix it. For details, please refer to references. For example, to fix a cve on Anolis OS 23: yum update --advisory ANSA-2024: xxxx

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in the minimatch package. This flaw allows a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) when calling the braceExpand function with specific arguments, resulting in a Denial of Service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: To fix this cve, please use the installation method recommended by Anolis: find the corresponding system's errata on the cve page, and then use errata to fix it. For details, please refer to references. For example, to fix a cve on Anolis OS 23: yum update --advisory ANSA-2024: xxxx

notes.text: A flaw was found in decode-uri-component. This issue occurs due to a specially crafted input, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: To fix this cve, please use the installation method recommended by Anolis: find the corresponding system's errata on the cve page, and then use errata to fix it. For details, please refer to references. For example, to fix a cve on Anolis OS 23: yum update --advisory ANSA-2024: xxxx

notes.text: A flaw was found in the c-ares package. The ares_set_sortlist is missing checks about the validity of the input string, which allows a possible arbitrary length stack overflow. This issue may cause a denial of service or a limited impact on confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: To fix this cve, please use the installation method recommended by Anolis: find the corresponding system's errata on the cve page, and then use errata to fix it. For details, please refer to references. For example, to fix a cve on Anolis OS 23: yum update --advisory ANSA-2024: xxxx

notes.text: A privilege escalation vulnerability exists in Node.js <19.6.1, <18.14.1, <16.19.1 and <14.21.3 that made it possible to bypass the experimental Permissions (https://nodejs.org/api/permissions.html) feature in Node.js and access non authorized modules by using process.mainModule.require(). This only affects users who had enabled the experimental permissions option with --experimental-policy.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: To fix this cve, please use the installation method recommended by Anolis: find the corresponding system's errata on the cve page, and then use errata to fix it. For details, please refer to references. For example, to fix a cve on Anolis OS 23: yum update --advisory ANSA-2024: xxxx

notes.text: An untrusted search path vulnerability exists in Node.js. <19.6.1, <18.14.1, <16.19.1, and <14.21.3 that could allow an attacker to search and potentially load ICU data when running with elevated privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
